summary: Email correspondence between attorneys regarding proposed redactions to documents pursuant to a court order in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The email chain involves prosecutors and defense attorneys discussing the review of documents and the filing of a joint letter with the court regarding redactions to protect third-party privacy interests.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Appears as a recipient and sender in email chain regarding document redactions in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Sabina Mariella
persons.context: Copied on emails discussing proposed redactions to documents in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Initiates email regarding documents per Judge Nathan's order and is involved in conferring with the government about redactions.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Recipient and participant in email chain regarding document redactions in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Issued an order directing parties to confer about redactions to documents in the Maxwell case.

connections.description: Communicating about legal strategy and court orders regarding document redactions.
Exchanging documents and coordinating on response to court order regarding redactions.
Prosecution and defense attorneys conferring about proposed redactions to protect third-party privacy.

events.title: Email exchange regarding document redactions
events.description: Attorneys discuss proposed redactions to documents pursuant to Judge Nathan's order in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, 401 E. Las Olas Blvd. Suite 1200, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301
keyFacts: The email chain involves coordination between prosecution and defense attorneys regarding redactions to documents in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The redactions are proposed to protect third-party privacy interests as directed by Judge Nathan's order.
The correspondence shows procedural steps in the Maxwell case regarding document handling and court filings.
Multiple law firms and attorneys are involved in the review and redaction process.
